page.title: 01POLESWORTH AND DORDON
page.content:
Polesworth is situated on the River
Anker at a fordable point.There was a nunnery built here originally but it was later the development of coalmining that led to its further growth.More recently people have been attracted from the Birmingham area to private house building.The new M42 motorway may well add to Polesworth's importance. There are two markets held in Polesworth.A weekly outdoor market and on Bank Holidays a market is now held at Hermitage Hill Dordon is very much a village centred on the colliery.It has coal board and council estates and workers have been attracted to the area from all parts of the country. The brickwork are no longer in use.The whole area is surrounded by farmland.
